titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of the collection at the SUNY Upstate Medical University Health Sciences Library
titlestmt.author: Nicole R. Topich

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections at the SUNY Upstate Health Sciences Library

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.unittitle: The 52nd General Hospital Collection
did.abstract: This collection contains the papers of the World War II 52nd General Hospital, which was affiliated with Syracuse University College of Medicine and stationed at Camp Livingston, Louisiana and Kidderminster, England. The collection has five series: Photographs, Audio-Visual Materials, Memorabilia, Printed Materials, and Subject Files.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: In 1922, the Syracuse University College of Medicine was authorized to organize and staff the 52nd General Hospital. It was organized in 1941 during World War II and called to active duty on September 1st, 1942 for basic training at Camp Livingston, Louisiana. The unit was then briefly transferred to Camp Kilmer near Brunswick, New Jersey before embarking on January 2nd, 1943 on the Queen Elizabeth with 18,000 troops. On January 8th, it disembarked at Grenoch and was taken by train to Taunton, England. It remained at Camp Norton until March 1st, when they were transferred to the permanent hospital at Wolverley, near Kidderminster, England. The unit treated casualties from the D-Day invasions and the Battle of the Bulge and was most active during its last year and a half before its dissolution on June 14th, 1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the papers of the World War II 52nd General Hospital, which was affiliated with Syracuse University College of Medicine and stationed at Camp Livingston, Louisiana and Kidderminster, England. There are five series in this collection.

Photographs: these materials include negatives and print photographs of the 52nd GH donated by various individuals. Almost every photograph has been digitized and can be viewed on the Archives and Special Collections METS database or on the New York Heritage and Digital Public Library of America websites.
Memorabilia: this series contains oversize certificate and poster memorabilia from the unit.
Printed Materials: these documents include printed materials about the unit, including newsletters, newspaper clippings, emails, transcriptions, and published maps and articles.

Subject Files: this series has various sub-series of individuals and events relating to the 52nd GH in a variety of formats, including photographs; writings, such as correspondence, notes, and diaries; ephemera that is loose and mounted in scrapbooks; audio-visual materials; and printed materials, such as publications, newsletters, photocopies of federal records, newspaper clippings, and extensive original documentation on the camp from Dr. Farr.
Audio-Visual Materials: these materials include various audio-visual materials from the 52nd GH, including CD, VHS, DVD, cassette, 78rpm vinyl, and 16mm film recordings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The 52nd General Hospital Collection has been arranged into five series.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Several items have been removed to the objects collection, including a WWII Japanese gas mask kit and leather army field medical kit from Kenneth W. Wright, the flag used in the 2008 memorial dedication ceremony, and a plaque in honor of the University Hospital of the Good Shepherd staff who served in the military. Some names are missing from this plaque, but the remaining ones are: Dr. E.G. Allen, Dr. J.B. Alsever, Dr. W.D. Alsever, Dr. A.U. Acuilino, Dr. W.D. Ayer, Dr. C.O. Barney, Dr. L.G. Berman, Dr. S.C. Bregande, Dr. S.A. Britten, Dr. J.C.M. Brust, Dr. T.L. Bryant, Dr. G.T. Church, Dr. J.E. Delmonico, Dr. Ecker, Dr. R.D. Fairchild, Dr. R.S. Farr, Dr. R.C. Farrow, Dr. L.G. Fournier, Dr. C. Geiger, Dr. R.O. Gregg, Dr. A.E. Harris, Dr. G.D. Hoople, Dr. H.C. Kroon, Dr. Max Kutzer, Dr. P.H. Lowry, Dr. J.R. Myers, Dr. [J.]W. Pennock, Dr. A.B. Raffl, Dr. P.H. Rakov, Dr. C.D. Reid, Dr. [Rubenstein], Dr. D.B. Sanford, Dr. F.J. Schoeneck, Dr. P.W. Smith, Dr. J.B. Stevens, Dr. S.W. Stringer, Dr. Irving [?]. In addition, the books Song and Service Book for Ship and Field: Army and Navy. New York: A.S. Barnes and Company, 1942 and Manual for the Medical Department United States Army 1916 were removed to the rare books collection.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on this material.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from the Archives and Special Collections of the SUNY Upstate Health Sciences Library and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:
The 52nd General Hospital Collection, Archives and Special Collections in the Health Sciences Library, SUNY Upstate Medical University

did.unittitle: Photographs
Rowlingson, Brewer, and unknown donations. All photographs have been digitized and can be found on the New York Heritage website.
Photographs and correspondence from George D. Lynch to Max Kutzer. All photographs have been digitized and can be found on the New York Heritage website.

dao.title: Negative and print photograph copies of mascot created by Corporal Fitzgerald.

did.unittitle: Negatives of England maps and the Massage and X-Ray Wing from Foster C. Rulison.
Photographs from Klett taken in the Wolverley area.
Photocopies of group photographs of the unit.
Mounted photographs, postcard descriptions, summary of the unit, and prisoner of war and family accounts from England and Louisiana compiled by Wardner D. Ayer.

dao.title: Oversize group photographs of the 52nd General Hospital and of wives of the 52nd.

did.unittitle: Memorabilia

dao.title: Certificate of Appreciation from the War Department Office of the Surgeon General to Syracuse University for the 52nd General Hospital.

did.unittitle: Poster for the 1st Anniversary Dance of the 52nd in the ETO.
Certificate from the Medical Department Army of the United States for Syracuse University to organize the 52nd general hospital.
Printed Materials
Special Map A of Georgia with Protractors printed by the ROTC.
Transcriptions of oral histories and articles, information, and emails on the camp from Mike Webster.
Newspaper clippings.
Elizabethan News newsletter, series 10, no.1-5. Preservation photocopies in previous clippings folder.
Wartime in Wyre Forest publication with Wolverley US Army Hospital article.
Subject Files
Leon G. Berman

Ephemera: souvenir program for “Skirts” musical by US 8th Air Force; program for Dr. Malcolm Sargent and the Liverpool Philharmonic Orchestra performance in Birmingham; program for piano recital by Lieutenant Edward Kilenyi; and newspaper photograph of nurses from Syracuse hospitals leaving with the medical unit.
Research notes, obituary, and correspondence excerpts on Leon G. Berman and the 52nd General Hospital from Paul Berman.
Photocopies of documents from the National Archives and Records Administration on the 52nd General Hospital.
Richard S. Farr

Business cards, newspaper clippings and obituary, negative of portrait photograph of Dr. Farr, and brochures for Orthopedic Teaching Laboratory, Gait Analysis, and Zimmer Reduction Retention Apparatus.
Publications and 52nd documentation, including rosters, reports, telegraphs, certificates, correspondence, orders, and pay and allowance accounts.
Lecture and medical notes.
Assignments of officers at Camp Livingston in Louisiana.
Receipts from England.
Travel maps and brochures, memos, ophthalmology reports, Easter service program, and group photographs of the 52nd.
Printed questions for oral answer for 2nd sitting day and typed “To the Class of 1943-Those famous juniors of a year ago” by Lt. Col. Wardner D. Ayer.
Standard Terms for Diagnosis, coding instructions (numerical code for records or punch cards), and coding for diseases.
Correspondence with Dixie and daughter Sally.

List of cash expenditures, hospital regulations the 52nd general hospital A.P.O. 651, personal correspondence, physical examinations and communications concerning physicals, receipted invoices, and instructions for movement.
Ephemera, including invitations, daily bulletins, greeting cards, and notes.

dao.title: A Christmas Card featuring the 52nd General Hospital Mascot.

did.unittitle: Registrar’s file, including procedure for admission of patients at 52nd general hospital; discharge procedure; procedures for evacuation of boarded patients; procedure for reception and evacuation of battle casualties; photocopy of battle casualties after D Day; Circular #37 “Records and Reports for Sick and Wounded”; instructions and administrative forms from Ward Office.
Promotion of officers, orders, and Camp Livingston assignments and lists of officers and men.
“Miscellaneous” items, including “Table of Organization” pamphlet, admissions and discharges statistics, correspondence, ETO medical society program, and information on visits and beds.
Orthopedic staffs and consultants at UK Base Hospitals and Dr. Farr’s evaluation of orthopedic staffs.
Syracuse newspapers from Victory in Europe Day, the end of World War II, and Franklin Delano Roosevelt’s death.
Admissions and discharges charts.
Kenneth W. Wright

Administrative manual for the coordination and integration of activities relative to hospital release procedures in Onondaga county prepared by Division of Patient Services, Kenneth W. Wright and Francis X. McCann.
For use in my public health lecture syllabus: paper on ethics by Kenneth W. Wright.
Partial list of newspaper clippings, presentations, official pronouncements, article on Ray Brook State Tuberculosis Hospital, and photograph from Kenneth W. Wright.
Problems of primary care: material for syllabus for K.W. Wright’s talks.
Unpublished paper by Fred Beck and Kenneth Wright having to do with the Herman M. Biggs Memorial Tuberculosis Hospital.

Yank Magazine, Tokyo Edition, October 12, 1945, v.1, no.3 and November 30, 1945, v.1, no.10 and British edition, May 19, 1945, v.3, no.48; clippings from 1945 on divine wind and kamikaze, Pullman Car Company advertisement, Princess Elizabeth, Cyclone Division and Bataan, Hiroshima and Nagasaki, US Army Units shoulder insignia; The Sunday Cloner from July 29, 1945; Life article, “U.S. Occupies Japan”; and from Yank, The Army Weekly, “Yanks in the Far East.”

Scrapbook created by Lois Wright with newspaper clippings, hotel receipts, church programs, photographs and brochures from Louisiana, Caduceus: The Voice of the Medical Battalion newsletter, drawings, clothing patches, Army Song Book, reference guide to military insignia, Cycloner newsletters from Camp Livingston in Louisiana, copies of photographs of Kenneth W. Wright and his wife Lois Wright, and correspondence between Kenneth W. Wright and his family, including telegrams, World War II postcards, greeting cards, envelopes, and letters.
Biographical Vignettes from foundations well and truly laid the early history of SUNY health science center at Syracuse by Kenneth W. Wright.

Two draft manuscript copies and sourcebook for second edition of "foundations well and truly laid a history of the state university of New York health science center at Syracuse” and "from teaching college to research university: the first hundred years of the SUNY health science center at Syracuse University college of medicine, 1834-1934" with photograph of Kenneth Wright and Millie Ashmore RN.
John Rowlingson
Dr. Rowlingson notes and photocopies.

Ephemera and maps from the March of the XX Corps, golf courses, postcards, a dinner, a theater, a dance at Bewdley, baseball at Halesowen, and the 93rd bomb group travelling circus celebration of the completion of 391 bombing missions by the 8th air force.

dao.title: Invitation to the 93rd bomb group travelling circus celebration of the completion of 391 bombing missions by the 8th air force.

did.unittitle: Eugene W. Anthony
Two photographs and photocopies of correspondence and publications.
Arthur D. Ecker
ETO medical society program, correspondence and information on 52nd reunion, and photocopies of clippings, travel orders, and notes.
Wardner D. Ayer
Scrapbook made by Dr. Ayer with newspaper clippings, correspondence, and reports.
Scrapbook made by Dr. Ayer with newspaper clippings, postcards, telegrams, theater programs, photographs of family and England, and correspondence.
Transcription of Dr. Ayer’s correspondence received from Dr. Kenneth Wright.

Kenneth W. Wright’s two student notebooks for Wardner D. Ayer’s neuropathology and neurology courses with lectures, case presentations, pathology findings, illustrations and drawings, photographs, publications, notes, test questions, and Dr. Ayer’s epilogue last lecture before departing for World War II service.
Photocopies of Dr. Ayer’s obituary.
Information and lists of glass lantern slides from Dr. Ayer.
Winifred P. Johnson
Nurse Winifred P. Johnson’s wartime diary in four volumes.
Partial transcription of wartime diary by Barbara L. Harris.

Brewer, Ecker, and Kutzer Health Sciences Library Lecture, Slides, Photographs, Exhibit, and Publication “Syracuse College of Medicine in World War II” and "Medical Contributions of the 52nd to the European Campaign" in the SUNY HSC/Syracuse Medical Alumni Association Alumni Journal.
2003 Jo Grant BBC report
Correspondence, press releases, notes, and photocopies of newspaper clippings on Jo Grant being the BBC Midland Today’s Young Reporter of the Year.
CD recording of A Brief History of Wolverley Camp narrated by Jo Grant from Wolverley Camp Archives.
VHS recording of Wolverley Village 1944 US Army Camp by Jo Grant for the BBC Midlands Today report.
2008 memorial dedication
DVD recording of “Somewhere in England: The dedication of a memorial to the 52nd General Hospital at St. Johns Church, Wolverley on 29 June 2008.”
Copies of photographs from the ceremony.
Brochures, correspondence, newspaper articles, donors, sponsors, and guest list for the ceremony.
Audio-Visual Materials
CD recording of photographs and audio recordings from the SUNY Upstate Archives and audio recordings by Barbara Harris RN PhD with Vince Steele, Alice Reynolds, Max Kutzer, and Winifred Paul Johnson.
VHS recording copy of 16mm film by Lieutenant Colonel Richard S. Farr for Brewer.
Cassette recording copy by Belfer archive from the 78rpm vinyl single sided 12 inch discs.
Cassette recording of interview with Max Kutzer by Barbara Harris with transcription.
Cassette recording on the 52nd general hospital.
16mm film of 52nd general hospital by Lieutenant Colonel Richard S. Farr for Brewer.
Correspondence on and 2 DVD recordings of “Wolverley Camp: The Story.”

78rpm vinyl single sided 12 inch discs from US General Hospital WSYR and BBC on August 21, 1943 that includes Lieutenant Colonel Richard Farr, Captain Ivy Wadsworth Sergeant Thomas Wagoner and many names of Syracusans stationed at hospital. Broadcast was underwritten by Herman G. Weiskotten for $25,000 in war bonds and narrated by Art Feldman.
